love it, absolutely just love it. 10/10

If you like working on generators or running away you'll like this game.

I'm 1400 hours into this game, and I wanna be banned to stop playing it. It's that bad but I stick around to play with friends. 

The twins has been the worst addition to the killer roster, by far. Seeing as no one on my server runs them anymore, it's safe to say they don't even exist here. EAC is pretty incompetent in preventing hackers and it's up to the community to report and ban them. And frankly, it's not easy, because you need to go to forums and what else. Even I don't know. And at this point, hackers are a part of dbd as much as every other aspect of the game.

I am sad that this game has turned out like this. There's no more feeling of belonging anymore. The maps I used to know and love are now butchered to a sad mess that I'm depressed just playing on the maps. Knowing what they used to look and behave like makes it all the more painful to keep playing this game as they constantly change it from what I loved. 

Farewell, dbd before every graphical update. You will be missed.
Very original game, great community and fun to play.
if you like horror movies, this is the game for you!!

okay so i got this game on playstation yeeeeaaars ago. i played it non stop when i first got it. i even got into some of the higher ranks somewhere between 8-6. then i fell off. new games came out i got distracted. honestly i feel like i havent realy played dbd since getting a pc about a year and a half ago. just found out today i have put 57 hours into this game just on pc. this game is addicting to the point that a come back to it periodically and still put in 57 hours. i play sporadically enough that my rank plumitted and im stuck in the noob ranks
Muy divertido, en especial con amigos, lo recomiendo 100%

game's pretty trash but so addictive

If they had a play at your own risk button, I would've chose it. I have many warnings with DBD. Be prepared for many bugs. Be prepared to be face camped, tunneled, mori'd off hook, etc. For new players, god speed o7. Fun things with this game are going against meming killers, killers that play fair and well, a game when a bug doesn't occur. Other than that, good luck if you wanna play this game. Dbd has literally sucked life out of me and money. Yes, it has it's good moments but more bad than good.

Please just, don't play or buy this game. I'm trying to help you.
If you want this game to play as killer, don't. Save yourself the salt and mental health, find a better game (it won't be hard to do, in all honesty)

--- 1. The devs for this game are a masterclass in incompetency. They are arrogant, malicious, patronizing, disingenuous, and ignore player feedback through-and-through.
2. There's a bug that will wipe ALLLLLLLL of your progression, character levels, unlocks, bloodpoints, perks, items, addons, 
   cosmetics, even special limited time things you can't get any more, EVERYTHING
   and guess what, the devs won't do anything, they won't help you.
3. The Devs support NFTs, as evidenced by their awful pinhead NFT agreement.
4. The bloodpoint grind is extremely absurd, there have been many suggestions for alleviating it but the devs just couldn't care less.
5. The community is immensely toxic, league and dota have nothing on this game's playerbase.
6. Recently, the boil over perk for survivors got buffed. As it stands, survivors can literally NOT BE HOOKED by simply going to specific parts of the map, and as killer, there's NOTHING that you can do about it.
7. Updates regularly introduce new and game-breaking bugs, the resident evil and 'binding of kin' update being notable examples taking months to fix, even having a 'new' map be immediately disabled for months due to constant crashes during loading in.
8. Terrible joke of a so-call "s k i l l -based" matchmaking system.
9. The battlepass is terrible, the free-track is a joke (as expected), having garbage low-effort and recolored charms and MAYBE one or two cosmetics in it (and near the end, obviously) and the paid track is filled with a hefty amount of filler. The grind is also far higher than it has any right to be, especially considering the type of game this is. Regularly forcing you to play in boring, unfun, or plain difficult ways to complete poorly thought-out challenges to be rewarded with SCRAPS of a SINGLE tier in the battlepass.
10. The devs are immature and petty, recently, a streamer lightly expressed dissatisfaction with the game, and a dev ACTUALLY just retaliated by removing that streamer's cosmetic from the game. The behavior is abhorrent, unprofessional, anti-consumer, and actively spitting in the face of freedom of speech.

   The list goes on, but if you're still interested in this crapshoot of a game, there's nothing I could say to dissuade you from it, just know that I tried to warn you.


   The devs have proven to consistently be grossly incompetent and (recently,) even immature and petty. Recently there was a streamer that very LIGHTLY expressed his disapproval of the direction the game was taking, and, incredibly enough, a dev ACTUALLY just removed that streamer's in-game twitch shirt. How petty can you be? Honestly, it's funny, petty, but still funny, like a child throwing a tantrum and lashing out any way it can.
   Devs are bad, like, almost comically bad. They don't understand how statistics work, or basic common sense. On one hand, they say that the twins are OP at high 'mmr' and yet they'll buff the nurse and blight, hypocrites.

MMR rant below this point
_______________________________
   The MMR system is an absolute joke and there's no unranked, only sweaty ranked. The only change your MMR based off if you survived or not, and as killer it tracks how many sacrifices you got in the match. Sounds fine, right? Yeah, until you realize it's pathetic. The devs have even gone on stream to state awful takes such as "if you loop the killer the entire match and all 5 gens get done thanks to you, and you die at the very end while your other teammates escaped, guess what, you're garbage at the game, obviously not good and your MMR will decrease accordingly."

   This is roughly the equivalent of playing a Dota or League ranked game, lets say you're playing support, you play insanely well, being a massive help to your team, in fact your team even goes flawless, no one died even once, an absolute stomp, your team is at the enemy's base, bashing the ancient/crystal in and the enemy manages to kill you once during it, the game ends and MMR gets updated, your teammates' MMR goes up, but yours goes DOWN because you died (because clearly you're not at the proper skill bracket due to your death) and the enemies' MMR also goes up slightly, because they killed you.

   Another MMR example but for killer this time. You play well the entire match, hook every survivor twice but don't quite kill someone, guess what, your MMR goes down as a complete Loss because of 0 sacrifices, even though hooking everyone twice 8/12 hook phases) is quite good and shows you clearly did very well. Doesn't sound that bad yet, right? Well now picture this with the previous result in mind. You pick leatherface, you down the first person and take them to basement. And then you just stand there, not leaving the basement, literally just standing there, waiting. The usual basement-facecamping bubba match takes place, all gens get done and everyone leaves, the leatherface gets one, maybe 2 kills, and it's MMR goes up accordingly to 2 kills. That's ridiculous, the leatherface quite literally didn't properly participate in the game and got MAYBE 3 or 4 hooks. The MMR system would lead you to believe the leatherface is the better player, just plain ridiculous.
